column4: They use udp (most of them) so they are *really* light (compared to the whole tcp package)
too bad webmin isn't in the repos any more
has he been on WinXP all the time? No wonder cat doesn't work
mplayer will do that, if you run it form the command line.
but isn't there a program that only does that?
i see that quite a lot, also with other feeds. Are they all bad feeds?
I'd have to look at the feed, but if they show up in another reader properly, then you know its the reader, not the feed.
is there a way to give this device some standard rights?
devices don't have rights, what are you trying to do?

the /dev entry i mean. For Kino to use my firewire device the program has to have full rights to /dev/raw1394. This can be accomplished by running Kino as sudo or chmodding /dev/raw1394. But i'm looking for a permanent solution
you need to edit the udev configuration for that to work permanently.
default font for gnome-terminal is Monospace 9
